definition: to feign/to pretend to be/to pass oneself off as
to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover
to fill/to satisfy/to fulfill/to act in place of/substitute/sufficient/full

sentences.english: He got the idea that I should pose as an UNRRA representative.
sentences.chinese: 他想出一個主意，叫我冒充一名“聯總”代表。

sentences.english: I do not pretend to possess equal frankness with your ladyship.
sentences.chinese: 我並不冒充我也象你老人家一樣坦白。
我們甚至還夠不上冒充僞裝。

sentences.english: Prevalent on the market is expected to roll posing as seed material.
sentences.chinese: 市場上多見冒充籽料的滾料。

sentences.english: Second, most people posing as deficit hawks are faking it.
sentences.chinese: 第二，冒充預算鷹派的大多數人是在作假。

sentences.english: He deceived her by pretending to be a famous movie star.
sentences.chinese: 他冒充著名電影明星來騙她。

sentences.english: Whoever poses as a People’s policeman in order to practise fraud shall be given a heavier punishment according to the provisions of the preceding paragraph.
sentences.chinese: 冒充人民警察招搖撞騙的，依照前款的規定從重處罰。

sentences.english: I don't reckon I'll be able to pass off a stag as a goat a second time.
sentences.chinese: 我恐怕不能第二次再用山羊去冒充牡鹿了。

sentences.english: Phoebe calls him pretending to be Estelle, and Joey fires her.
sentences.chinese: 菲比冒充埃斯特拉打電話給喬伊，遭喬伊解僱。

sentences.english: Stop pretending to be a ghost, you frighten no one.
sentences.chinese: 冒充鬼物嚇唬人了，沒人怕你。

sentences.english: As for those Saints in troubles, everyone with common sense can tell those are shams.
sentences.chinese: 麻煩重重的，明眼人一看就知道那些都是冒充的。

sentences.english: Some people still pretend to be Hei Daolai gally me.
sentences.chinese: 有些人還冒充黑道來恐嚇我。

sentences.english: He later impersonates the president of the parent company and arrives at his old plant on an inspection tour.
sentences.chinese: 後來他冒充母公司的總裁到他原來工作的廠裏視察。

sentences.english: As is known to all, fake and inferior commodities harm the interests of consumers.
sentences.chinese: 衆所周知，冒充僞劣商品損害了消耗者的長處。

sentences.english: Every year, a lot of people commit crimes by counterfeiting registered brands.
sentences.chinese: 每年都有很多人在冒充註冊商標行詐。

sentences.english: Someone could grab that image and use it to pretend to be me.
sentences.chinese: 有人可能會截取圖片，並用它來冒充我。

definition: to impersonate/to pose as (someone else)/to counterfeit/to palm off (a fake as a genuine)
to impersonate/to act the part of sb/to disguise oneself as sb else
to entice/to lure/to scam/to hoodwink/to decoy
taken in (by sb's deceit)/to be fooled/to be duped
to assume sb's name and take his place (idiom); to impersonate/to pose under a false name
to steal sb's valuable item and substitute a similar-looking but worthless item/to sell a fake for the genuine article/to palm off
